thread.title: PHOTOS: President Luis Guillermo Solís visits areas affected by floods in Costa Rica's Limón province
thread.title_full: PHOTOS: President Luis Guillermo Solís visits areas affected by floods in Costa Rica's Limón province -The Tico Times

author: Alberto Font
title: PHOTOS: President Luis Guillermo Solís visits areas affected by floods in Costa Rica's Limón province
text:
President Luis Guillermo Solís visited damaged areas in the Caribbean province of Limón on Wednesday and Thursday after heavy rains last weekend caused floods in Costa Rica’s Caribbean and northern regions.
President Solís inspected Route 32 and visited communities in Guápiles, Matina, Siquirres, Sixaola and Talamanca. Using a Panamanian helicopter he also conducted flyovers to assess the damage.
Although weather conditions have improved and rainfall has returned to normal levels, pineapple and banana plantations are left with serious damage, and public infrastructure needs to be rebuilt as thousands of people that were evacuated return to their homes.
Read more of our rainy season coverage here.
President Luis Guillermo Solís checks the damage at the Río Sucio bridge on the road to Sarapiquí in Guápiles, Limón on Wednesday, July 1.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Part of the bridge over Río Sucio on the road to Sarapiquí in Guápiles, Limón was destroyed due to heavy rains and flooding last weekend.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
A backhoe works near the Río Sucio bridge on the road to Sarapiquí in Guápiles, Limón on Wednesday, July 1.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
President Luis Guillermo Solís flew over the damaged areas in a Panamanian helicopter on Wednesday, July 1.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
A banana plantation worker in Matina, Limón shows how high the waters rose during the floods last weekend.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Flood damage at a banana plantation in Matina, Limón.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
A banana plantation worker at one of the affected plantations in Matina, Limón on Wednesday, July 1.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Backhoes work on the banks of the Matina River in the province of Limón after heavy rains caused flooding in the area last weekend.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Large areas of a banana plantation were destroyed after the Matina River flooded last weekend.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
President Luis Guillermo Solís visits a banana plantation that was affected by the floods in Matina, Limón.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Flood damage at a banana plantation in Matina, Limón.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
President Luis Guillermo Solís visits a school affected by the floods in Siquirres, Limón on Wednesday, July 1.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
A flooded road in a community near Siquirres, Limón.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
